docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 -- A political purge affecting high officials in the Cuban regime may result from public sessions of "criticism and self-criticism" that are to open tomorrow in Havana over the worsening food crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 -- A political purge affecting high officials in the Cuban regime may result from public sessions of "criticism and self-criticism" that are to open tomorrow in Havana over the worsening food crisis.
docs.abstract: Govt orders 'criticism and self-criticism' pub hearings on acute shortage; directs agr leaders to attend; reptdly seeks to fix blame for difficulties; speculation on resulting pol purges; Washington sources believe Min Guevara in uncomfortable spot in role as econ chief

headline.main: CUBA FOOD CRISIS MAY CAUSE PURGE; Hearings Today Will Affect Top Aides in Havana

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 -- State Department officials were perplexed tonight by the news of the resignation of President Janio Quadros of Brazil, whose foreign policy had been a source of growing concern to the United States.

docs.snippet: With Cuba as the lone dissenter, the nineteen other nations of Latin America and the United States joined together at Punta del Este, Uruguay, on March 16 in a ten-year "Alliance for Progress."
